channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Supplements sold at Sam's Club nationwide linked to salmonella outbreak: FDA
item.description: Illnesses connected to using the product have been reported in Kansas, Florida, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, New York and Michigan. Three people who contracted salmonella were hospitalized, according to the CDC.
item.dc:creator: Kyler Swaim, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Biden immigration policies under fire after illegal immigrant with prior DUIs charged in 14-year-old's death
item.description: An Illegal immigrant with two prior DUI arrests is accused of killing a 14-year-old California student in a hit-and-run crash, highlighting failures in immigration enforcement.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday moved to limit the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children's teeth, the latest action by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his deputies against a chemical that is a mainstay of dental care.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW PERRONE, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Judges order Trump administration to use emergency reserves for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: BOSTON (AP) — Two federal judges ruled nearly simultaneously on Friday that President Donald Trump’s administration must continue to pay for SNAP, the nation’s biggest food aid program, using emergency reserve funds during the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL CASEY, GEOFF MULVIHILL and KIMBERLEE KRUESI, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: New Pentagon policy undercuts trans troops' ability to ask to stay in the military, AP learns
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Pentagon has rolled out a new policy that will severely undercut the ability for transgender troops who have been banned from the armed forces by the Trump administration to turn to boards of their peers to argue for their right to stay in the military, according to a memo obta
item.dc:creator: KONSTANTIN TOROPIN, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: EA reports decrease in sales, lose content creators amid buyout
item.description: EA has reported a 13% dip in overall sales of $1.81 billion despite significant gains in its Madden NFL and Sports FC franchises.
item.dc:creator: Cher Hwang, NewsNation

item.title: Judge orders arrest of ex-Green Beret tied to failed Venezuela raid after court no-show
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — A federal judge in Tampa has ordered the arrest of a former Green Beret accused of plotting to invade Venezuela in 2020 after he failed to show up to court for a hearing on whether he should be taken back into custody for violating the conditions of his pre-trial release.
item.dc:creator: CURT ANDERSON and JOSHUA GOODMAN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Drug gang linked to murder of Colombian rapper, DJ
item.description: Mexican authorities are reporting the arrest of 16 people in connection to the murder of two Colombian artists last month.
item.dc:creator: Julian Resendiz, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and other content from YouTube TV amid breakdown in talks
item.description: YouTube TV viewers can no longer see Disney channels, including ABC and ESPN, after the two sides failed to agree on a new content distribution deal.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Trump urged GOP-led states to redraw US House districts. Now other states also are gerrymandering
item.description: President Donald Trump's call for Republicans to redraw U.S. House districts ahead of next year's election has triggered an unusual outbreak of mid-decade gerrymandering among both Republican- and Democratic-led states.
item.dc:creator: DAVID A. LIEB, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Dad knifed on way to Halloween fest, kids save him from 'demonic stare' maniac with dino sticker, charger cord
item.description: A California father was stabbed multiple times during an unprovoked road rage attack while driving his children to a pumpkin patch in San Diego County.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Alabama man charged with threatening rabbis, imam and others in multiple Southern states
item.description: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) — Federal prosecutors have charged an Alabama man with making threatening calls and texts to multiple rabbis, an imam and others in the South, including telling one rabbi that “I want you to die.
item.dc:creator: KIM CHANDLER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two judges could rule as soon as Friday on whether President Donald Trump's administration must replenish SNAP food aid benefits for November despite the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: LA firefighters ordered to leave fire that exploded into Palisades Fire days later: report
item.description: Firefighter text messages reveal crews were ordered to leave the origin site of the devastating Palisades Fire despite hot tree stumps, a new report said.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Top blue city university's newspaper tracks ICE operations amid frequent violent clashes with feds
item.description: University of Chicago student newspaper launches interactive ICE tracking map, soliciting community tips on federal immigration enforcement activities in local neighborhoods.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Last-minute scramble over pay takes a toll on military families during the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The government shutdown is exacting a heavy mental toll on the nation's military families, leaving them not knowing from week to week whether their paychecks will arrive.
item.dc:creator: BEN FINLEY, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Blue city perp with 50+ arrests accused of pushing stranger onto train tracks in fifth attack that day: report
item.description: Repeat offender with over 50 prior arrests goes on alleged violent crime spree targeting Asian victims across Manhattan, including subway platform assault.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Photos: Trumps host Halloween event at White House
item.description: President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump hosted trick-or-treaters on Thursday in a Halloween celebration that has become a fun White House tradition.
item.dc:creator: The Hill, Fox 5

item.title: Why some schools have been spooked out of Halloween
item.description: Religion, politics and student participation are all among the reasons some schools have abandoned Halloween celebrations that put candy-filled children in bulky costumes in classrooms.
item.dc:creator: Lexi Lonas Cochran, KRON4

item.title: Trump says Senate should scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO AP Congressional Correspondent, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Louisiana deputy accused of orchestrating inmate-on-inmate attack
item.description: Danny C. Taylor, 40, is facing serious charges after allegedly directing an inmate to assault another inmate.
item.dc:creator: Erykah Agers, NewsNation

item.title: NASA takes one step closer to launching quiet supersonic jets
item.description: A supersonic jet plane designed to make very little noise took flight for the first time this week, cruising over the southern California desert just after sunrise in what could be the first step toward much faster commercial travel, according to NASA. NASA and the U.S.
item.dc:creator: SAFIYAH RIDDLE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: CBP seizes 166 exotic pets, including pythons and tarantulas, from car traveling to Mexico
item.description: A total of 166 reptiles and arthropods were identified within the vehicle, including dozens of pythons, numerous lizards, multiple frogs and several tarantulas.
item.dc:creator: Mia Morales, KRON4

item.title: Confirmation hearing for Casey Means, Trump's surgeon general nominee, delayed after she goes into labor
item.description: (The Hill) – The nomination hearing for Casey Means, President Trump’s nominee for surgeon general, in front of the Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions (HELP) Committee, has been postponed. A spokesperson for the committee, chaired by Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.
item.dc:creator: Max Rego, KRON4

item.title: Cruise passenger, 80, found dead on island after ship's crew leaves without her
item.description: The passenger’s daughter Katherine Rees on Thursday accused the cruise company Coral Expeditions of a “failure of care and common sense” that left her mother Suzanne Rees to die alone.
item.dc:creator: Rod McGuirk, KRON4

item.title: The Latest: Trump says he has deals with China after meeting Xi to try to solve trade tensions
item.description: President Donald Trump said he's made deals with China after meeting Chinese leader Xi Jinping on Thursday, the final day of a trip to Asia that was an opportunity for the leaders of the world’s two largest economies to stabilize relations after months of turmoil over trade issues.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Senate hearing for Trump's surgeon general pick is postponed after she goes into labor
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A Senate hearing for President Donald Trump's surgeon general pick, Dr. Casey Means, has been postponed because she went into labor, a spokesperson for the Senate health committee said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Trump, Xi agree to ease trade war in high-stakes meeting
item.description: President Donald Trump announced an agreement with Chinese President Xi Jinping to ease their trade war following a meeting Thursday, with the U.S. scaling back tariffs and China delaying export controls and resuming some soybean purchases.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, KRON4

item.title: Vance spars with college students at Turning Point USA event
item.description: Vice JD President Vance went toe-to-toe with college students at the University of Mississippi on Wednesday in a nod to his friend and the late conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Erika Kirk's words spotlight forgiveness in a divided nation
item.description: “That man, that young man — I forgive him.” Erika Kirk softly spoke those words about the gunman accused of assassinating her husband, conservative activist Charlie Kirk, as she struggled to hold back tears last month during his memorial service. Her public declaration inspired another.
item.dc:creator: DEEPA BHARATH, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Community fights pickleball replacing basketball courts at South Florida beachside park
item.description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) — Basketball players who frequent a South Florida park feel like they’re being run off in favor of wealthy residents of a new luxury development.
item.dc:creator: DAVID FISCHER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: US will share tech to let South Korea build a nuclear-powered submarine, Trump says
item.description: GYEONGJU, South Korea (AP) — The United States will share closely held technology to allow South Korea to build a nuclear-powered submarine, President Donald Trump said on social media Thursday after meeting with the country’s president.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS MEGERIAN and JOSH BOAK, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: A timeline of US attacks off South America and what Congress has had to say
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — In less than two months, President Donald Trump and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth say, the U.S. military has killed at least 61 people in 14 strikes against drug-smuggling vessels in the Caribbean Sea and eastern Pacific Ocean.
item.dc:creator: BEN FINLEY and KONSTANTIN TOROPIN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Chicago's children are getting caught in the chaos of immigration crackdowns
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — The 2-year-old boy was so frightened, he stuttered. “Mommy, mommy, mommy,” he repeated, clinging to her. His mother, Molly Kucich, had been grocery shopping when her husband called, panicking. She heard “immigration raid.” Then: “tear gas.
item.dc:creator: CLAIRE GALOFARO, Associated Press, ABC 4
